review_text: Clifford Park, part of the Wissahickon Valley Park in Philadelphia, is steeped in history and natural beauty. The park is named after George Clifford Thomas, an investment banker and philanthropist whose 1869 mansion still stands within its bounds. Upon his death in 1907, Thomas‚Äôs estate was donated to Fairmount Park, enriching the city‚Äôs green spaces. Today, Clifford Park is a testament to Philadelphia‚Äôs dedication to preserving its historical landmarks while providing residents and visitors with a peaceful retreat into nature.
Nice oasis not far from where I live. Never a lot of people most of the time it's just me walking or sitting and meditating.
Great place to take the kids to learn how to play baseball

Peaceful dog friendly kid friendly as all the amenities that are needed at a park

This isn't a dog park, it's just some trails and a field where you can walk your leashed dog. There is no fence, and part of it runs along the very busy and dangerous Lincoln Drive. There's also a stream that runs thru it that has some kind of industrial pollution situation on-going-- it's bright orange and is staining anything nearby orange.
This is not a dog park. I love the fields here, but it is being misidentified! Dogs are supposed to be leashed in this park as they are in almost all Fairmount Park managed properties.
Nice area with wild grass and a few trails to walk your dog on. There's a nice half hour loop around the Thomas mansion. You pick the trail up from the field down the hill to the left.
